title: Define Project Scope and Requirements - REVISED
description: Gather and document detailed requirements for the OilSpillCleanupRobot project, including functional requirements (e.g., navigation, oil detection, collection mechanisms), non-functional requirements (e.g., autonomy, durability, safety, scalability, maintainability, energy efficiency, user interface design), constraints (e.g., regulations, environmental factors, operational conditions, data security and privacy, compatibility with existing infrastructure), success criteria (e.g., cleanup efficiency, cost-effectiveness, reliability, adaptability), future upgrade considerations, and contingency plans for potential challenges such as extreme weather conditions or unexpected malfunctions. The defined scope and requirements should be detailed enough to guide the design, development, testing, and implementation phases of the project. This RFC will also include a clear definition of the project's goals and objectives, and an outline of the system architecture. The focus should be on creating a clear, comprehensive, and actionable document that can serve as a foundation for the entire project lifecycle. This RFC is currently in draft state.

title: Design System Architecture for OilSpillCleanupRobot
description: Design the overall system architecture, including hardware components, software modules, communication protocols, and integration points. Ensure the design adheres to the following aspects: 1) Modular design for easy maintenance and upgrades, 2) Scalability to handle varying spill sizes, 3) Robust error handling and fault tolerance, 4) Real-time monitoring and reporting capabilities, 5) Integration with external systems (e.g., mapping, weather data), 6) Security measures to prevent unauthorized access or tampering, 7) Energy efficiency to maximize operational time, 8) Consider the impact of marine life during design and operation, 9) Include guidelines for testing and validation, 10) Plan for future AI/ML integration for optimized performance, 11) Break down the task into smaller, manageable sub-tasks for efficient implementation. In addition, consider the following points: a) Provide detailed specifications for each hardware component and software module, b) Research and suggest potential solutions for marine life detection and avoidance, c) Provide a high-level system flowchart to help visualize the architecture.

title: Develop Robot Hardware
description: Design and manufacture the physical robot components, including the chassis, motors, sensors, and other hardware components.

title: Develop Control Software
description: Develop the software for controlling the robot's movement, navigation, and oil cleanup operations.

title: Develop User Interface
description: Design and develop the user interface for monitoring and controlling the robot remotely.

title: Implement Data Storage and Analytics
description: Design and implement a data storage solution for storing sensor data, mission logs, and other relevant data, and develop analytics tools for data analysis and reporting.

title: Establish Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Develop a comprehensive testing strategy including unit testing, integration testing, system testing, and regression testing. This will involve creating test cases for various scenarios, edge cases, stress tests, and extreme conditions to validate the robot's functionality, reliability, and performance. Additionally, consider implementing a continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline for automated testing, with a focus on improving test coverage and reducing manual intervention. To ensure thorough testing, it is recommended to involve team members from various roles such as hardware developers, software developers, UI/UX designers, data storage specialists, and DevOps engineers.

title: Implement Security and Compliance
description: Ensure the robot's software and communication systems are secure and compliant with relevant regulations and industry standards.

title: Comprehensive Deployment and Maintenance Plan for OilSpillCleanupRobot
description: Develop a comprehensive deployment strategy for the autonomous OilSpillCleanupRobot in real-world oil spill scenarios. This strategy should include logistics for transportation, on-site setup procedures, and regular maintenance routines to maximize performance and lifespan. Emphasis is placed on robustness, scalability, safety, and adaptability to various environmental conditions. The plan should also address the following: remote control capabilities, emergency shutdown mechanisms, data transmission protocols, and disaster recovery plans. Furthermore, provide guidelines for troubleshooting common issues that may arise during deployment.

title: Create Documentation and Training Materials
description: Develop comprehensive documentation and training materials for end-users, maintenance personnel, and other stakeholders.
